# Equation in Multiple Equation Format

$$\begin{aligned}
y_{ij} = \beta_{0j} + \beta_{1j} x + e_{ij} \\
\beta_{0j} = \gamma_{00} + \gamma_{01} \text{sector} + u_{0j} \\
\beta_{1j} = \gamma_{10} + \gamma_{11} \text{sector} + u_{0j} 
\end{aligned}$$ {#eq-multiple}

::: {.callout-tip}
## Random Effects Are Optional

The random effects in @eq-multiple are *optional* in the sense that they may or may not be included. Often only a *random intercept* is included. Inclusion of multiple *random slopes* may lead to non-convergence of the model.
:::

# Intra-Class Correlation Coefficient

$$\text{icc} = \frac{\text{var}(u_{0j})}{\text{var}(u_{0j}) + \text{var}(e_{ij})}$$

# How Many Levels?

For the $i^{th}$ student in the $j^{th}$ school in the $k^{th}$ district.

$$\begin{aligned}
y_{ijk} = \pi_{0jk} + \pi_{1jk} a + e_{ijk} \\
\color{red}{\text{there are p level 1 coefficients}} \\
\pi_{pjk} = \beta_{0pk} + \beta_{1pk} + r_{pjk} \\
\color{red}{\text{group specific effect for the jth group}} \\
\color{red}{\text{there are q level 2 coefficients}} \\
\beta_{pqk} = \gamma_{0pq} + \gamma_{1pq} w + u_{pqk} \\
\color{red}{\text{there are p*q level 3 coefficients}} \\
\end{aligned}$$ {#eq-multiple3}

# A Single Level Equation

Using substitution, we re-write @eq-multiple.

$$y_{ij} = \gamma_{00} + \gamma_{01} \text{sector} + \gamma_{10} x + \gamma_{11} \text{sector} \times x + e_{ij} + u_{0j} + u_{1j} \times x$$ {#eq-single-gamma}

Let's just call everything a $\beta$.

$$y_{ij} = \beta_{0} + \beta_{1} \text{sector} + \beta_{2} x + \beta_{3} \text{sector} \times x + e_{ij} + u_{0j} + u_{1j} \times x$$ {#eq-single-beta}

::: {.callout-tip}
## $x$ is $\text{ses}$

In the concrete example that I am using $x$ is $\text{ses}$
:::
